intro: Lasianthus guineensis, commonly known as African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically has a short, upright stem with fleshy, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Lasianthus guineensis prefers indirect light and well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
